result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David J Simington

records.addlTxt: All records scanned

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David J Simington in court with attorney Kathleen Renee Lang. Defendant David J Simington in custody. Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter: Robin Anderson
Plea:
14CF555: count 3 - NC
14CF1293: count 1, count 2 & count 5 - NC

BTC: 
13TR10870: DRI
14CF1294: DRI

14CF555: count 3 - GUILTY; DRI the balance.
Count 3- 5 Years WPS, 3 Years init, 2 Years es, i/s, 3 Years Probation, to run consecutive to 14CF1293 & to present sentence

14CF1293: count 1, count 2 & count 5 - GUILTY; DRI the balance.
Count 1- 5 1/2 Years WPS, 2 1/2 Years init, 3 Years es, to run concurrent to present sentence 

Count 2- 5 1/2 Years WPS, 2 1/2 Years init, 3 Years es, to run concurrent to present sentence & concurrent to count 1

Count 5- 5 1/2 Years WPS, 2 1/2 Years init, 3 Years es, to run concurrent to present sentence & concurrent to count 1 & count 2

Conditions: 
No drugs, no alcohol
Any assessments, treatment or programming as deemed appropriate by the agent
Obtain & maintain employment
No contact with the victims G.Z. & J.B. in 14CF555
Pay court costs on count 5 in 14CF1293 & count 3 in 14CF555
Provide a DNA Sample & pay surcharge on count 5 in 14CF1293  & count 3 in 14CF555
FAW
VOTE
Not eligible for CIP but is eligible for ERP

Defendant David J Simington in court with attorney Donald L. Conner.  Defendant David J Simington in custody.  Matthew J. Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin. Competency has been raised. BTC: Comp eval has been ordered.  Competency hearing scheduled for November 4, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Donald Conner
Preliminary hearing on October 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victim JB, LC, GZ, KP (person, property, residence or family).   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  $208 advanced fee for installment of SCRAM must be paid prior to release from jail. Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) to monitor - 524 S Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780).  No contact with Prairie Dr.   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant David J Simington in court with attorney Margaret Marie Johnson.  Defendant David J Simington in custody.  Noah Wishau appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.
